casebody.data:
State of Connecticut v. Paul G. Dowen (13379)

O’Connell, La very and Heiman, Js.

Argued November 29 decision released December 20, 1994 Gilbert Shasha, for the appellant (defendant). Rita M. Shair, assistant state’s attorney, with whom were C. Robert Satti, Sr., state’s attorney, and, on the brief, Peter McShane, assistant state’s attorney, and Stephanie A. Lane, certified legal intern, for the appellee (state). Per Curiam.

This case is controlled by State v. Tucker, 226 Conn. 618, 629 A.2d 1067 (1993), and State v. Esposito, 223 Conn. 299, 613 A.2d 242 (1992).

The judgment is affirmed.
